THE SECRET TO WASH + GO HAIR I am really bad at doing my hair. Pretty much the more effort I put into it, the worse it's going to look; the more hair tools I've had to plug in, the more likely I'll be walking out of there completely overruled by my weird cowlicks. It is what it is.(I was just having a conversation with Henry Holbrook about this yesterday. I'd said "it is what it is," and he asked what that meant, and suddenly we were having this in-depth discussion about feeling satisfied versus feeling thrilled, and don't you think that probably as a species we'd all do well if we took what seemed decent and just called it amazing? I mean, we have no business expecting the things we sometimes expect around this place. which isn't to say we should all aimlow, necessarily, but more that... well, whatever this is getting boring.)So I got this weird idea into my head a few years ago that all of our parts made to do what they do for a reason. You know, "whatever thou art, do well thy part." Well, if there's one thing iIve learned after 31 years, it's that my hair has a definite idea of what it wants to do with itself, and there is really no point in arguing with it. So last year I decided to see whether or not my hair and I could reach an understanding on things if I finally let it find its passion. You know, if you love it, set it free. Aren't most relationship troubles caused by senseless control issues? I washed my hair and then didn't touch it. I let it dry how it pleased, and then I said to my hair, "Okay, hair. Hi. So, you just tell me what you want to do here. I will do whatever you tell me to. But until then, I'm out of this one." So, well I didn't really say this out loud.After a few days of not washing or brushing my hair, just "observing"my hair (oh my gosh, I've totally lost you by now haven't I), I came to a few scientific conclusions: 1. If I don't fight my cowlicks, they kind of take care of themselves in a weird way that isn't too awful. 2. My hair wants to poof, and actually, if I respect the poof, the poof can look pretty okay. 3. Hair that's a little dirty iswayeasier to negotiate with than hair that is too clean.And now I present unto you my hair routine, as dictated by the evil tyrant that's growing from my head./ One:Dry Shampoo/ Crucial. I really prefer the powders to the aerosols. Not only will I probably spare myself some awful lung disease in the future, and not only do the powders get the same job done using far less product, but also, with powder, I've been able to swing a full 10 days between washes (which is gross, and also, amazing). I apply it at night; just a tablespoon of powder at a time into my palms, rub my hands together, then rake through my roots where I typically get greasy. The more the better, and a little gray sheen is okay. By morning it's gone and my hair is ready to roll. I use a little more in the morning to freshen up, and then i'm off.Note: I don't work out strenuously. I'm running around outsideconstantly, but I'm not doing anything that makes me get too sweaty all at once (unless it's sickeningly hot outside), so I don't experience issues with odor or sweat. Your mileage may vary. A good dry shampoo will neutralize odor, but only up to a point./ Two:Moroccan Oil/ I lighten my ends every six months, so I try to keep them happy in between times. Twice a week or so is plenty. (I'm going to have to saycoconut oilgets the job done better.)/ Three:Elnett hairspray/the only hairspray you ever need. i use it the first day after i've washed my hair, otherwise my hair is one flat sally./ Four:Sachajuan Ocean Mist/this is a salt spray, and maybe the best one on the market. i use it the first few days after a shampoo. my hair wants to be a little wild and mussy, and this stuff is so great for adding a little texture + volume so the muss looks evenly wild, and mostly on purpose. ;)/ Five:Mason Pearson brush+comb/ I only brush my hair a few times a week, just to get some of those good oils from the top of my head on down to my ends. (A good brushing before a dry shampoo will make it ten times more effective, FYI.) I'm going to have to say, it was worth the investment./ Six:Krastase shampoo+conditioner/ Since I'm only shampooing once a week, I decided I could treat myself to the very best. It's pricey, but one bottle can last me four or five months. (!!!!) What happened was, I tried a sample sized bottle once and the difference in my hair was so unbelievable that I promptly chucked everything else in my shower and converted immediately. I usually towel my hair dry and then comb just out my bangs. And then i sleep on it.And that's seriously it.Other notes: I've been cutting my own hair for a little over a year now and it's saved me so much time and money, not to mention angst. if I happen to screw up I'm much more likely to forgive myself, on account of I was free.Any questions? Any tips? I'm curious about your hair routines! Spill it.

Review: Kerastase Beautifying Oil Cream is the answer to your dry hair prayers I have made no secret of the fact that Kerastase is my ultimate number one hair care brand. Their products are pricey enough now, but oh so worth every single cent of your hard earned Eurobucks, and if you save Kerastase for your "Sunday best" their products will last you ages. Look at it as an investment.Anyway enough of me trying to justify all the hair shopping. I was lucky enough to be sent the brand spanking new Kerastase Beautifying Oil Cream to review and no surprises here, I got on great with it. I was very interested to ... stage, and this contains a good enough amount to actually nourish hair, Maize Oil which is used in the famous Kerastase hair masques, and finally Camellia Oil to repair and give hair a brilliant shine.I have just adored using the Beautifying

Hair Holy Grails: III Catch up with Part 1 and Part 2 of my Hair Holy Grails series if you haven't seen those posts. In the third instalment we have quite the eclectic mix - a hair spray, a conditioner and a heat styling product:1. Kevin Murphy Blonde Angel ConditionerThis is the best tone correcting hair product I have tried. If you have highlighted hair and want to keep the brassy tones in check, look no further. Not only does it smell amazing and conditions the hair well without making it feel greasy or weighed down, but it is incredibly rich in purple pigment which is the key to neutralizing any orange tendencies that your highlighted hair might have. Kevin Murphy is an Australian brand and can be quite hard to get a hold of (I'm lucky to go to a hair salon that stocks the products) but I have had luck finding and ordering some of the products from Amazon.2. Moroccanoil Luminous Hair SprayI have been using/buying this for over two years and I can't be bothered to stray. Best hairspray ever. It has a medium flexible hold, smells like heaven, doesn't weigh the hair down and boosts it with a hint of airy volume. Oh, and it also adds shine. What more can you ask for? Get it at most salons (this brand is everywhere) or on Feelunique with free worldwide shipping!3. Krastase Ciment ThermiqueThis "restructuring milk for weakened hair" does just that. You apply and massage it into damp hair, focusing on the areas of most damage, which is usually the ends. It is then heat activated so when you blow dry/use styling tools it protects those fragile bits of your hair and strengthens them through the entire styling process. It has a pleasant scent and it doesn't weigh my fine hair down at all. It has made a huge difference in the condition of my split ends. Now it doesn't fix split ends (no product no matter how magical it claims to be will ever be able to fix split ends) but it does prevent future split ends from happening, which is good enough for me!xxSandra

52 Black Friday Deals to Score Beauty Products on a Budget 
It's that time of year again. Yes, time for one of America's most beloved traditions. No, we're not talking about Thanksgiving. We're talking about Black Friday. 
Once the turkey coma has subsided and the Macy's parade is over, there's only one thing left to focus on: buying beauty on a budget. 
Whether you're shopping for others or treating yourself (no judgment), brands that participate in Black Friday always guarantee the best deals of the year - and makeup, hair, and beauty lines are no exception. Here's to getting all your holiday shopping done in one day . . . and snagging a few gifts of your own. 



Anastasia Beverly Hills: Step up your eyebrow game with products reduced by 25 percent. 
MAC: The brand is releasing a limited-edition lip pencil in Berry Black Friday, available online only. 
Red Door Spas: Use code RedFRI15 in spas to receive 15 percent off all retail purchases of $100 or more.
Ghd: All hot tools 25 percent off - excluding the Arctic Gold Holiday collection.
Avon: Spend $40 or more at avon.com to score 20 percent off plus free shipping. Shell out $65 or more to nab a case filled with travel-sized items. Use the code BLACKFRIDAY. 
Moroccanoil: Drop $100 or more via the brand's online site to receive a free Moroccanoil Hand Cream Trio ($72 value).
Elizabeth Arden: Score free shipping on all online orders, and use code BLACKFRIDAY at checkout to get a free full-size Skin Renewal Booster ($65 value) with purchases of $90 or more.
The Body Shop: Spend $36 or more and get a tote stuffed with 10 products for $35 ($139 value). The bag includes a lip butter, body butter, shower cream, soap, body polish, shower gel, hand protector, mini scrub, bath cream, and, for the first time, the Drops of Youth Concentrate.

Tatcha: Use code FF2015 to save 20 percent on everything at tatcha.com.
Peach and Lily: Grab Korean beauty products for 20 percent off at peachandlily.com.
Stowaway Cosmetics: BOGO when you buy a six-piece Stowaway Cosmetics Kit online. Each kit is customizable and includes one BB cream, concealer, rouge, eyeliner, lipstick, and mascara ($75 value).
Victoria's Secret Beauty: Choose five beauty essentials for $25, in-store only.
Bobbi Brown: Spend $50 and take home a complimentary holiday gift set.
L'Occitane: Buy $165 or more of products online and get a complimentary Advent calendar ($50 value).
Red Door Spas: If you spend $100 or more online, you'll nab a bonus spa voucher of $30 ($100-$199 spent), $60 ($200-$299), or $90 ($300+).
Make Up For Ever: The Waterproof Hero Kit will be on sale at Make Up For Ever boutiques and Sephora for $10 ($27 value). There are other kits on sale, as well!

Zoya: Build your own six-piece ($30, $54 value) or 12-piece ($50, $108 value) dream box of polish.
Rituals: Buy one shower cream and get one shower foam free, both in-store and online.
Krastase Paris: Save 10 percent on all online orders, and get free shipping on orders of $75 or more.
H20+: Snag the "blockbuster set," which includes toner, body wash, nail cream, cleanser, makeup remover, and more, for $27 (a $40 value). Limited quantity available online and in its Chicago store.
Lorac: Ulta is exclusively launching Lorac's Love, Lust and Lace Shimmer and Matte Palettes, retailing during Black Friday for $12 each (reduced from $50).
Obsessive Compulsive Cosmetics: Free shipping (within the US) on all purchases of $50 or more. The line is also launching its new "Asphalt World" collection on Black Friday at occmakeup.com.
Tata Harper: All full-size purchases come with a complimentary travel-size version and free shipping.

NYX Cosmetics: Snag a free High Voltage Lipstick with any purchase in NYX retail stores or online. 
Karuna: Sample the brand's sheet masks for $15 ($28 value).  
Silk'n: Save 25 percent on sitewide purchases and get free shipping with code SILKNBF.
Nourish Organic: Use code GREEN50 to get a sitewide discount of 50 percent.
BR: Grab any item for 25 percent off at Target.com.
Mally Beauty: Buy online and save 30 percent on all purchases. 
PR Cosmetics: Score 20 percent off all online purchases by using code BLACKFRI15.
Arcona: Spend $200 or more and get 40 percent off your purchase and free shipping, available online and in the Santa Monica studio.

Urban Decay: All online purchases will be 20 percent off, including its signature palettes.
Caudalie: Spend $100 at boutique locations and receive two travel items of your choice and a makeup pouch.
June Jacobs: Get 24 percent off all online orders as well as free shipping and a full-size Neroli Mist gift with purchases of $50 or more.
Laura Geller: Use promo code FRIDAY25 to save 25 percent on all orders (or FRIDAY30 to save 30 percent on orders of $100 or more).
Jeffrey James Botanicals: Purchase the "Cyber Monday" five-piece set for just $30 (an 85-percent-off deal); includes free shipping.
Blowpro: Hair tools have been reduced to $79 each ($139-$165 value) on Nordstrom.com.

Top 10, Bottom 10 Fashion & Beauty Picks of 2014 2014 has been a great year. I started my first full time job, I've gotten serious about my blogging, I became a Yelp Elite and I've started exploring my creative side a lot more. I'm excited for 2015 and I know it will be full of fun adventures. But before we head into the new year, I want to share with you some of my best and worst fashion & beauty picks of this year.Top 10:1. Kiehl's Ultra Facial CreamMy go-to moisturizer, especially during the winter. My skin feels silky smooth and hydrated. It lasts all day too.Most moisturizers I've tried only last for a few hours. The Ultra Facial Cream isn't cheap, but it gets the job done. I place effectiveness over price any day. Check out what other skincare products I use daily here.2. Lancome La Base ProI love this. The first time I tried it, I was very surprised. It really makes my pores disappear and it makes my makeup last longer. Best primer I've used so far. 3. JC Penney Jada Brave Macien PumpsI can't believe I bought these heels for just $20! They're gorgeous and so comfy. The gold toe adds a nice touch to the regular black heel. Definitely one of my favorite pair of heels that I own.4. Bobbi Brown Skin Foundation in Natural 4I was color matched at Sephora and this is the foundation that the beauty advisor recommended. I asked for a sample. It lasted me about two weeks and it's my favorite liquid foundation to date. It offers heavy coverage, but it's matte and doesn't make my face too oily. 5. Acqua di Gioia PerfumeLove this perfume. It's light and fresh. Kind of reminds me of just-getting-out-of-the-shower feel. It's great for any time of the year. It made my Three Must Haves for Fall list here.6. Kate Spade HandbagMy favorite handbag. My boyfriend got me this for my birthday and it's perfect. I needed something to carry my big, bulky work laptop in and this does the trick. Granted not much else can fit I there when the laptop is there, but it beats carrying two bags to work everyday. Found in my OOTD post here.7. Vince Camuto HandbagI bought this while I was on vacation in San Francisco. I saw it and I immediately needed it. It's structured and has a sexy edge to it. Plus, I didn't own a black bag, so of course I had to get one. Find the bag in my OOTD here. 8. White Lace Shirt from SammydressThis is a really cute shirt. I've worn it so many times now. It's white, lace and see-through. But it's perfect. You can dress it up or down, plus I got it for such a great price. I used it in my OOTD here. Purchased from Sammydress at this link.9. Cape Jacket from SammydressDid you see my cape jacket? Did you, DID YOU? Sorry, I get excited when I talk about my cape jacket. I've been very daring lately, buying things I wouldn't normally wear and going for more edgy styles. This one cape I saw online reminded me so much of Blair Waldorf, my fictional style icon, that I just had to get it. Plus, it's a style that not many wear, which is why I'm also glad I got it. I stand out. You've probably seen it around my blog, like hereand here. 10. Customized Phone CasesThis was pretty cool. I was contacted to do a product review on a customized phone case, so I was able to create my own personal iPhone 4s case. It was pretty sweet and it turned out pretty nice as well. You can learn more about it here.Shop Top 10 Items Here: Bottom 10:1. Naked Beauty Balm by Urban DecayNope, not a fan. I really haven't found a BB cream that I love yet. The Naked balm is just that. It leaves you naked, but not like beautiful naked, where the cream hides your flaws and leaves you looking naturally beautiful. It's more of what you would see if you just woke up and looked in the mirror. The balm claims to reduce redness, which is completely false. Not even by a little. I'm a huge fan of UD, but this is definitely not one of my faves.2. Giorgio Armani Face FabricSuch a huge disappointment. I love a good foundation and Face Fabric is not it. It's exactly how it sounds, it feels like it's a part of your face. It's more of a face primer than an actual foundation. The feel and texture is exactly like that. I need a heavier coverage foundation, so this is absolutely not for me. Not worth the purchase either considering the price.3. L'Oreal Infallable Lip GlossHorrible formula. It was very sticky and it had a scent that I wasn't a fan of. The applicator was nice though. I tried to give it my friends and family, but no one really liked how sticky it was. Ended up throwing it away. Booooo!4. Julep Mystery BoxesJulep is an awesome brand. I'm obsessed with the brand. They present nail polish in a fun, new light. the polish bottles are cute and dainty and I really like the Maven program and the polish sets they offer. I've been tempted to buy so often, but I can't, seeing as my nail polish collection is out of control. One thing I hate though is their mystery boxes. I've fallen prey to these twice already. Mystery boxes can be fun, but they can be disappointi

With Love From Rush(ia)* A few weeks back I was invited to Rush, Kilburn branch to receive a complimentary cut and blow dry, normally starting at 49. Taking me an hour and a half to reach my destination on one of the hottest days of the year, I was greeted by wonderful a/c, a cool glass of lemon water and two delicious Lindor truffles (which I saved for my munchkins).After a quick introduction to my stylist, Roxi, we headed over to the shampooing station where I had the most luxurious shampooing (it felt like the best head massage!), and Roxi explained she would be using Krastase, specifically for thin hair whilst reducing frizz. I have found most hair salons have the shampoo room too bright, and the light always bothers my eyes, to where it can be intolerable. However, Rush has a delicate light, placed perfectly for the stylist, and completely out of your eyes. With this ambient lighting, I felt immediately relaxed.Next, Roxi and I discussed which cut would suit best, and the length. I gave her Carte Blanche, and she delved in with unbridled fervor, yet always asking throughout whether a certain chop here or there was acceptable. As I requested my right side be the longest, she merely trimmed it, whilst the left side of my face was cut to slightly expose the statement earrings I am prone to wearing.Eventually, the reshaping came to an end and with an additional Kastase product used in my hair to create volume, my hair was blow dried and flat ironed to what you see above (sorry I look so bad, no make up except mascara and lipstick that day). My stylist Roxi and the whole crew were completely professional, and just utterly lovely. I don't get my hair done very often, max two times a year, but in the future, I plan on going back to Rush, and most specifically, the Kilburn branch.Have you ever gone to a Rush branch? What was your experience like?P.S. Rabbit Rabbit!| Instagram | Twitter | Bloglovin | Google+ | Pinterest |

Do LOreal products really thicken hair? Episode 79 LOreal has a number of products that claim to actually thicken your hair. This week Randy and I take a look how these products work and which ones provide the best value.
Claim to Fame: Fructus Full & Plush Ends Plumper
This is the segment of the showgram where we look at popular personal care product claims and tell you what the claim really means, how it can be true, and whether or not it means the product is worth spending more money on. This week were looking at a hair thickening claim that used across several LOreal products most notably on Garnier Fructis Full & Plush Ends Plumper.
What is the claim?
We always start by reviewing the exact language of the claim because sometimes a claim implies something but doesnt really say it. So here are the exact claims from this Fructus product:

Our first targeted treatment with Fibra-Cylane and pomegranate that plumps wispy ends for a fuller look.
PLUMPS thinned-out ENDS*
penetrates and plumps hair for a full, voluptuous look.
Instantly the LOOK OF MORE HAIR*
Hair feels FULLER & looks THICKER*
Touchably SOFT & PLUSH*
*Garnier Fructis Full & Plush System of Shampoo, Conditioner & Ends Plumper treatment.

How can the claim be true?
First lets point out that some of these claims can be supported by almost any conventional styling product. Any product that leaves a significant coating on the hair (especially true of mousses, gels, putties, and so forth) can be said to make hair feel fuller. And any product that helps lock your style in place (like a hairspray) can say that it instantly gives you the look of more hair. So to some extent this sounds like the same old marketing speak. Claims like this can easily be supported by a salon test that shows when you style your hair and lock it in place your hair style has more volume.
But, some of their other claims refer to penetrating hair and thickening individual fibers which is NOT something you can achieve by coating hair with conventional products. So to understand how they might support those claims we need to take a closer look at their special technology which they call Fibra-Cylane. By reviewing their ingredient lists and looking at their patents, it appears that Fibra-Cylane is an ingredient called aminopropyl triethoxysilane.
According to LOreal, this ingredient works like this:
It penetrates the hair shaft, expands and strengthens the hair
itsSimilar to the silica gel used to fill cracks in car windshields, the technology is also inspired by wrinkle fillers for the skin
Filloxanes small molecules slip through hair cuticles, attracted like magnets to proteins inside the fiber. They bind to the hair proteins as well as to each other, forming a rigid, stable network that adds volume to naturally thin or aging hair
The idea appears to be based on what is called sol gel technology which involves converting a solution into a solid gel. This chemistry is used in glass coatings to fill in cracks. Heres a link to a video by one of the researchers who worked on the technology which features a petri dish demo of how it works. Although, she admits that its not a very realistic demo because it uses a highly concentrated solution. But still its interesting. Based on looking at the hair tresses in the video it looks like the material helps hair fibers hold their shape but without a heavy crust. Its easy to imagine how they could support these volumizing claims if thats how it works.
LOreal makes several mentions of how Fibra-Cylane penetrates hair. If the molecule is small enough this could be true and there are test methods that have documented silicone penetration into hair. For example, this 1995 paper talks show how silicones can penetrate through the cuticle and intro the cortex using an analtyical procedure known as scanning time-of-flight secondary ion mass spectroscopy (TOF-SIMS).
Should this claim persuade you to buy the product?
There SEEMS to be something significant here, but I couldnt find any clear evidence of how well this stuff works compared to conventional technologies. There are a number of patents related to using aminopropyl triethoxysilane on hair but I couldnt find anything like this stuff thickens hair fibers by 39% which is the kind of evidence Id like to see. There was a paper presented at one of the technical symposiums titled 3-aminopropyltriethoxysilane: A new compound stemming from sol-gel chemistry provides thin hair fiber with more volume but I havent been able to track down a copy to see if it provides more details.
So, it seems that LOreal may have some unique technology that can thicken hair from within but its tough to say for sure. The good news is, its relatively easy for you to try it for yourself. The bad news is that it can be confusing because LOreal uses this technology in no less than 6 different brands. AND, the prices varies wildly so you have to be careful which product you buy s

helps to leave hair feeling replenished and protected against external aggressors. Your SIY Toolkit:

Suave Professionals Luxe Style Infusion Volumizing Blow Dry Spray
Suave Professionals Luxe Style Infusion Plump Hold Hairspray
 Hair dryer with nozzle
 Round brush
 Hair clips

Step 1: Spray damp hair with Suave Professionals Luxe Style Infusion Volumizing Blow Dry Spray starting at your roots and working your way down to your ends. Separate hair into small sections and secure using clips to make the blow dry process easier.
Step 2: Begin blow drying starting at the back of your head with a round brush, focusing on the roots to create lift. Pull the brush through your hair as you work your way down the hair shaft, while twisting your wrist as you reach the ends to create a loose wave.
Celebrity Stylist Insider Tip: For top sections, point the dryer nozzle upward underneath each section while lifting hair up and away from your face to achieve extra volume at the roots.
Step 3: Spray Suave Professionals Luxe Style Infusion Plump Hold Hairspray all over to lock in the volume for up to 24 hours.

amount of it mixed in with the vinosource. i am sure there is the perfect moisturizer but i haven't found it and i've been searching a long time.  and here's the cool part...i can customize it every with your moisturizer for a subtle bronze-y glow. 6. dr. jart black label detox BB beauty balm- you need to get on board the BB train. this stuff is worth the splurge. i use it exclusively in place of regular foundation.  it really really really is so much more awesome than foundation. 7. eco tools skin perfecting brush- this is a must if you use BB cream. 8. shiseido natural finish cream thing to wear with just concealer and lip salve. i use it in place of blush and on my forehead, chin and nose.  it's pretty universally flattering, and comes in 2 shades. 10. lorac pro palette- buy Start with Luxe Style Infusion Weightless Blow Dry Spray on damp hair, from roots to ends.
Using a round brush, blow dry up and away from face.

December and January Empties The past few months have been so hectic, so much so that my blog posts have been lacking and I haven't had the chance to blog about my empties. I thought I'd quickly sneak this empties post in on my last day off before I start my first day of work tomorrow as a Reese! (In case you weren't aware, I got hitched over the weekend.) I will have a blog post up as soon as I collect enough photos. I have posted a few photos over on Instagram if you'd like to check it out here.Over the last two months, I have used up a number of products, most of which are re-purchase worthy!1. Wotnot Facial Wipes sample pack (5 wipes)I brought these to America over the Christmas/New Year break. Wotnot facial wipes are one of the best makeup removing wipes I've ever tried. Would definitely repurchase.2. Simple Kind to Skin Cleansing Facial Wipes sample pack (7 wipes)I also brought these with me to America. Comparing the Simple ones to the Wotnot ones, I much prefer Wotnot because they're more moist than the Simple ones. However, these Simple wipes are pretty good too.3. Face of Australia Purifying Cleansing WipesThese wipes have made an appearance in quite a number of my empties post. Whilst they are not the best facial wipes on the market, they are a great value for money when on special. Unfortunately, this is the last packet in my facial wipes stash, so they won't be making an appearance in my empties post for a while, as I really want to get through my stash before repurchasing more.4. Elemis FreshSkin Make-up Away Cleansing WipesI'm on the fence with this product. Whilst it's relatively good at removing makeup without making my skin feel yucky, the smell of this didn't appeal to me at all. Furthermore, it's expensive compared to other facial wipes, which are equally effective. Probably won't be repurchasing this. 5. Lancome Genifique Youth Activator sampleI couldn't see any improvements in my skin after using this. But it didn't leave my skin feeling sticky, which is always a plus. And I didn't get any breakouts from this.6. Nivea Light Moisturizing Day Cream sampleI actually quite like this day cream. I love the smell of Nivea body lotions, and this had the typical Nivea scent. It was light, and didn't take long to absorb into my skin. I thought it worked rather well with my oily skin when I was in LA (it was winter there).7. Laura Mercier Foundation PrimerI'm not crazy about this but I don't hate it either. This primer has more of a lotion consistency rather than a silicone one (i.e. Benefit Porefessional), which is what is best suited for my skin type. However, it did the job in providing a smooth canvas for foundation application.8. Agave Healing Oil Smoothing ConditionerI purchased the Agave set when I was in the states, after using the oil treatment and falling in love. The set came with the conditioner, shampoo and oil treatment. I used up the conditioner first (as usual... the shampoo will appear further down). I wasn't impressed with the conditioner. In fact, I was downright disappointed. Whilst it smelt really good, it did nothing to "smooth" my hair. My hair was still dry, frizzy, and slightly tangled after using it. Will not be repurchasing this.9. La Roche-Posay Effaclar Purifying Foaming Gel sampleI used this with my Clarisonic and didn't think it was "foamy" at all. I thought it was an ok facial wash. It didn't strip my face of all its natural oil leaving it uncomfortably tight and it smelt good. I might repurchase this if it was on special and there was nothing else available. 10. Neutrogena Oil-Free Acne Wash sampleSimilar to the La Roche-Posay facial wash, this was nothing to write home about. It got the job done but it failed to really wow me. I think the missing factor in these facial washes were the cooling menthol factor, which I absolutely love in my facial cleansers.11. Aveda Purifying Gel Cleanser sampleI wasn't a big fan of this. From memory (I used this up in December), it didn't seem to lather, which I dislike in facial cleansers. I found myself squeezing out more than necessary amounts to use this up quickly. Will not be repurchasing.12. Lancome Hypnose Drama in Excessive Black sampleIt was time to say goodbye to this mascara. I've been using this for travels for quite a long time, and I didn't think it was healthy to keep this mascara any longer. It was a fantastic mascara that provided volume without clumping. Would definitely repurchase!13. Tarte Amazonian Clay smart mascara sampleAnother great mascara. This mascara was great in separating lashes, and coating each lash making them look fuller. I was sad to let this mascara go.14. Estee Lauder Lash Primer Plus sample This lash primer was also fantastic. It provided length and volume, and complemented the mascaras above. Would repurchase.15. Agave Smoothing ShampooAs mentioned above, I purchased this in a set. I was also quite disappointed in this shampoo, as it didn't do much in the "smoothing" department. However, it

Bring Salon Style Home with New Suave Luxe at Target 
Sponsored Post
With NEW Suave Professionals Luxe Style Infusion products available at Target, you can bring salon-quality styling right to your home. Whether you want curls, volume, or a simple smooth look, theres a Luxe product that will work for you. Whats more, the entire line is proven to work as well as the expensive Krastase brand that salons use.

Find your Luxe Style Infusion products at Target from 1/11/14  2/7/15, and get a free $5 gift card when you buy 4 participating Sea Mineral Infusion or Luxe Styling Infusion products.
Try the VOLUME line for hair that feels touchable and is full of body and bounce. Go with frizz-resistant SMOOTH for sleek and shiny hair. Or create defined, weightless and luscious curls with the CURLS line.
Click here and let me know which NEW Luxe Style Infusion product would you like to try by tweeting me using the hashtag#NewLuxeStyle.

VOLUME Style Inspiration: Ultimate Body and Bounce
Start with Luxe Style Infusion Weightless Blow Dry Spray on damp hair, from roots to ends.
Using a round brush, blow dry up and away from face.
SECRET TIP: Roll 4-5 large sections of hair down onto scalp and secure with clips.
Complete the look with Luxe Style Infusion Plump Hold Hairspray for extra hold. Lightly brush through for a natural look.
SMOOTH Style Inspiration: Sleek Pony
Apply Luxe Style Infusion Weather Proof Cream to damp hair for a smooth finish. Using a flat brush, blow dry. STYLIST TIP: Blow dry in the direction of where the ponytail will set.
Spray Luxe Style Infusion Anti-Humidity Hairspray for hold. Brush into ponytail, securing elastic.
Take a small pinch of hair from ponytail and wrap around the elastic. Spray more for extra hold.
CURLS Style Inspiration: Braided top bun
Apply Luxe Style Infusion Soft Touch Curl Mousse on damp hair, then air dry. Make a high ponytail.
Braid the ponytail. Wrap it around the elastic while securing with bobby pins.
Pull out baby hairs for an easy breezy look.

Beauty Blog Coalition Weekly Roundup 11 May 2014 Hope youre enjoying a lovely weekend. Spring has finally sprung, and Ive been getting a lot of gardening done. Trying to play catch up now since we lost about a month of spring to a winter that wouldnt give up.
Today, Jeff and I may go canoeing on the Ipswich River. Weve missed canoeing on the river for the past couple of years so I hope we can fit it in.
Later, I hope to catch up on a few Beauty Blog Coalition blogposts that I missed during the week. If you have a chance, take a look. My post at the very end of the list is a review of a natural, mineral, gluten-free, vegan, cruelty-free lipstick from Gabriel Cosmetics that I found at Whole Foods.
This coming week, I hope to get a new giveaway up and running so stay tuned!
Have a good week!

24 Awesome beauty gift ideas based on favorite color Red
1. Zoya Amal MatteVelvet Nail Polish







Image: Zoya








Looking for a last-minute stocking stuffer? This chic matte crimson is a right-now take on the classic holiday red nail. Best of all, the formula is free of the “big 5”: formaldehyde, toluene, camphor, formaldehyde resin, and phthalate. (Zoya, $10) 
2. Shiseido Honey Cake Red Soap







Image: Sephora








This limited edition French-milled soap in bright red is infused with honey to gently cleanse and soften skin. (Sephora, $10)
3. Cle de Peau Bal Masqué le sérum






Image: Cle de Peau 







We’re coveting this serum not only for its luxurious formula, but the limited edition bottle that looks like an enormous red gem. The perfect statement gift for Mom or anyone else who deserves a major indulgence. (Cle de Peau, $325)
Pink
4. Beauty Blender pretty.posse






Image: Beauty Blender







This set reminds us of the play makeup kits we used to pine for when we were little. It comes with the classic pink makeup-blending wonder sponge, a blinged-out holder ring, a mini sponge for blending concealer and other fine-tuning, a cleanser and re.activate™ — a sponte re-hydrator and makeup refresher. (Beauty Blender, $45) 
5. Clarisonic Mia 1 Electric Pink Holiday Set






Image: Clarisonic 







The perennial fave of skin care enthusiasts everywhere made over in a fun electric pink hue. The set comes with cleanser and an extra brush head. (Clarisonic, $99) 
6. Slip Silk Sleep Mask







Image: Slip








A movie-star-worthy — and (literally) easy on the eyes — way to ensure a peaceful night’s sleep. This 100 percent silk sleep mask glides over delicate skin around the eyes without tugging or creating wrinkles. (Slip, $40)
Purple
7. Foreo Luna™ Mini







Image: Foreo








This silicone skin care brush uses sonic vibrations to gently yet deeply clean skin. We’re fans of this cool purple shade. (Foreo, $139)
8. MAC Irresistibly Charming — Purple Mini Pigments & Glitter Set







Image: MAC Cosmetics 








Perfect for the purple- and sparkle-loving lady in your life. This set comes with four boldly pigmented, shimmering powders from violet to lavender. (Nordstrom, $35)
9. ghd Amethyst 1” Professional Styler Set







Image: ghd








This limited edition jewel collection comes with the brand’s crowd-pleasing flat-iron, a matching paddle brush and keepsake box in shimmering metallic amethyst. (ghd, $235)
Blue
10. Nest Blue Garden Candle







Image: Nest








An elegant sapphire-blue glass holds a fresh floral blend of blue hydrangea, hyacinth and forget-me-nots. (Nest, $38)
11. Herbivore Lapis Facial Oil Set







Image: Herbivore








Thanks to the deep azure hue, this may be one of the prettiest facial oils we’ve ever seen. But it packs a powerful skin care punch. Blue Tansy oil helps hydrate, calm inflammation and reduce redness while antibacterial properties stave off blemishes. (Herbivore, $82)
12. Lipstick Queen Hello Sailor







Image: Lipstick Queen








This omega-3-infused gloss is a shimmering ocean-blue in the case but glides on to leave lips a flattering deep mauve hue. (Lipstick Queen, $25)
Green 
13. Peter Thomas Roth Cucumber De-Tox Hydrating Soothing Kit






Image: Sephora







A super-calming set of cucumber-based skin care products: De-Puffing Eye-Cubes, Foaming Cleanser, Hydrating Gel and the brand’s crowd-pleasing Cucumber Gel Mask. Tip: Stock them in the fridge for an extra cooling boost. (Sephora, $48)
14. Deborah Lippmann Calypso Duet






Image: Bloomingdale's







Two gorgeous lacquers, a pale seafoam and a glittery teal, are tucked into a mermaid-esque sparkling case. (Bloomingdale's, $19)
15. Honest Beauty Eyeshadow Trio






Image: Honest Beauty 







Three flattering shades make it easy to create an array of green-based eye looks, from a single hue swiped across lids, an ombre wash or an artfully contoured smoky eye. (Honest Beauty, $25)
Yellow
16. The Whole Truth Kit






Image: Ole Henriksen







Three vitamin-C-infused products to brighten, boost collagen and protect from damage. The set contains Truth Serum® Collagen Booster, Truth Crème™ Advanced Hydration and Total Truth Eye Crème SPF 15. (Ole Henriksen, $46) 
17. Lancome Drama Liqui-Pencil™ Longwear Eyeliner






Image: Sephora







We love a pop of unexpected color on eyes. This liner pencil glides on smoothly for precise application, making it the perfect tool for creating graphic looks — and a great stocking stuffer for the avant-garde beauty in your life. (Sephora, $23)
18. Versace Yellow Diamond Gift Set






Image: Bloomingdale's







A glamorous, sun-soaked fragrance set. Bergamot, neroli, orange blossom and freesia combine with richer wood and musk notes. Includes a gilded wristlet. (Bloomingdale's, $104)
Gold
19. NuFACE® Mini






Image: NuFACE® 







This travel-sized facial toning device uses micro-currents to stimulate and give the complexion

The Cold War Winter is a notoriously difficult beauty season because the icy temperatures and harsh winds can wreak havoc on your skin & hair. Even though we've only seen a little snowfall here in NY, I am already recognizing the need for an extra layer of moisturizer each morning and that my split ends are more noticeable after blow-drying. I've been switching up the products I use lately and have discovered, through a bit of trial & error, that combining certain treatments together can have a powerful & effective impact. I've been so impressed with these six options that I just had to share them with you today. Take a look at my favorites here and read on below for my personal reviews to hear why I love them.1) It's a 10 Miracle Leave-In with KeratinTo combat dry strands, I've been using this spray-on treatment which leaves my hair unbelievably soft and restores shine. Note: a little goes a long way, especially if you have naturally oily hair - just a light application is all you need!Krastase Carr Lissant Smoothing SheetsThis might be the greatest hair product invention of all time. Just lightly smooth over your strands to eliminate frizz, control static & tame flyaways. Great for traveling or stashing in your purse when you're on the go.2) Purest Palm Body BrushI was recently introduced to dry brushing for its health benefits (see how-to instructions here) & since making this a part of my daily ritual, I've seen a marked improvement in the overall condition of my skin.Boots Botanics Nourishing Body OilDuring the winter months, I usually need to step up to a more intensive body lotion to help give my skin the moisture it's craving. This oil formula instantly soothes my parched skin and leaves it feeling silky all day long.3) John Masters Organics Moroccan Clay MaskI love a good mask for pulling out impurities & giving my skin a healthy glow - this one is a new favorite because it's gluten-free, vegan & certified organic. I recommend using once a week before bedtime.BITE Beauty Agave Lip MaskFormulated without sulfates, parabens or phthalates, this moisturizing treatment not only keeps my lips soft & hydrated, it also gives them a subtle shimmer that's perfect for daytime.

10 Products That Will Actually Quench Dry, Damaged Hair Keeping dry, damaged hair looking and feeling as healthy as possible often feels likean uphill battle. We cant live without our deep conditioners, and only the most gentle shampoos are suitable for our compromised scalps and gruesome split ends.
Over the course of our endless journey to find the right combination of products that will turn our fried strands into silk (or at least something vaguely resembling silk), weve encountered some serious duds  and its safe to say that these quenching productsare notthem. Read on for 10 go-to products to set your dry, damaged hair right!
Philip B. Katira Hair Masque
Well be straight with you: We have next to no idea what, exactly, this legendary katira is. The packaging claims that katirais the magic of Persia, and while that doesnt really shed light on this magical ingredient,well take it. This intensive oil-free treatment is, for lack of a better word, incredible. Left on until the unique clear gel formula dries into a hard shell, then rinsed, it leaves even the most crispy hair glossy with shine, soft to the touch, and unbelievably light and bouncy. ($40, philipb.com)
Oribe Gold Lust Transformative Masque
There is nothing from the Gold Lust collection that could possibly be improved upon, from the luxurious packaging and sophisticated fragrance to  oh, yeah, the actual formulas. This masque is intense, and though it can be truly tedious to spend extra time in the shower as you wait for a treatment to sink in, this is one you wont want to wash off. When you finally get around to it, youll realize that they werent kidding when they said transformative. ($62, oribe.com)
Bumble and bumble Hairdressers Invisible Oil Heat/UV Protective Primer
A solid primer is the key to any good makeup look, so it makes complete sense that a priming hair mist would have similar qualities. This one can be used before heat styling to protect your hair from further damage, or on its own as a base for other products before drying naturally. It doesnt feel like much going on, but the special blend of lightweight oils packs a serious punch when it comes to detangling, de-frizzing, and taming flyaways. Oh, and it smells pretty great, too. ($26, bumbleandbumble.com)
Pureology Strength Cure Restorative Masque
We were a little confusedby this masque before we even tried it, since it describes itself as being optimal formicro-scarred hair. We never think of our hair as being scarred, but upon further thought, we agreed that damaged hair is sort of like scarred skin. This thick treatment goes deep to strengthen the hair at its core, and unlike most products of its ilk, it actually works to fortify the cuticle of each strand, making it feel stronger, softer, and less stretchy. We also appreciate that it helps protect and preserve our hard-earned color which is how we got in the micro-scarred boat in the first place. ($58.50, ulta.com)
Shu Uemura Ultimate Remedy Extreme Restoration Duo-Serum
Not only does the two-in-one packaging save us precious counter space, but the formulas inside are pretty darn impressive, too. One side of the dual-chambered pump contains a cream, while the other holds a thick serum that helps to seal the hair fiber and conceal breakage. Massaged into damp hair from the mid-length down, the combination nourishes dry areas and split ends. Added bonus: it can be reapplied throughout the day to control frizz and add shine. ($38, shuuemuraartofhair-usa.com)
Josie Maran Argan Hot Oil Self-Heating Hair Treatment
Lets be clearthese arent your mothers single-use oil treatments. Theyre packed with the brands signature argan oil, which is rich in vitamin E to reverse heat damage and leave hair smooth and healthy. Once opened (which youll do in the shower, ideally, because this oil can get messy), the oil self-warms (!) to better penetrate each strand of hair rather than just sit on top of it. Delicious  and at $36 for five super effective treatments, we dont think its a bad deal, either. ($36, sephora.com)
Davines Oi Shampoo
It smells like fresh laundry and somehow manages to give hair the perfect voluminous, soft, shiny texture, even and perhaps especially when air-driedwhat more could you want out of a shampoo? This ridiculously gentle cleanser is kind to hair and certainly wont strip it of color or moisture. Its rare to find a shampoo that feels good to apply rather than setting off an internal chorus of please let my dry hair still feel like hair after Ive washed it, but this one fits the bill. Its so good, you could skip conditioner  but we wouldnt recommend it. ($26, us.davines.com)
Krastase Elixir Ultime Moringa Immortel
This versatile nourishing oil is best likened to liquid gold, thanks to its gorgeous fragrance and countless benefits. Use it before you style or throughout the day to restore damaged hair with essential nutrients, or just to make it all look really, really s
name, Ive done it- from colouring to perming to straightening to all kinds of hair treatments and rituals ( as Kerastase calls them) [...]

The Surprising Secret to Perfect Air-Dried Waves 
 
My hair has always been unrulyslightly puffy and slightly feral, the type of mane that, since middle school, has cost hundreds of dollars in smoothing products and even more in flat irons that burn and fry, creating split ends that go up to the root. So how does this texture fare in the humid summer weather? It doesntonce the temperature goes up, there is no straightening iron in the world that could keep my untamable strands under control.
And it isnt easy to deal with. My coworkers have that covetable wash-and-walk sort of hairobedient lengths that are shiny and soft, which have never been touched by a silicone serum or 480-degree heat-up device. Until recently, I wrote off their good fortune as the luck of the genetic lottery and resigned myself to a life of frizz. But during a recent appointment at the Flatiron Districts Butterfly Studio, hairstylist Amanda Colihanwhose red hair resembles mine in textureshared a dependable technique that I could do on my morning subway ride or while eating breakfast in the morning.
Its about persuading your hair, says Colihan. We arent doing hardcore styling. So what exactly does it take? About 20 minutes of your time (depending on how fast your hair dries), a tiny amount of product, some sectioning, and mainly some twisting. As for myself, I test-drove it during my hour-long commute, and it is as easy as a flickor rather a twistof the wrist to get naturally air-dried hair with little effort. Here, a guide to getting it right.
1. Take a break from the age-old rule of brushing your hair after you get out of the shower. The more you mess with curls, especially, the straighter and frizzer they will get. says Colihan. In other words, do not do anything that will tamper with your natural texture from wash to finish.
2. Forget what you knew about towel-drying. Take the towel and dry from side to side in a scrunching motion. It is a way of taking the water out of your hair and starting to make your hair do what you want it to do, says Colihan. Even if you dont have curls and waves, you are getting it started.
3. Different textures require different productsbut dont overdo it. According to Colihan, start by asking yourself whether youre trying to create wavesor control them. If its the former, first, use Spray  Porter by Krastase on wet hair. It wont make it sticky, but it will hold it. This works for both fine hair or natural waves, says Colihan. If you have thick hair that needs sculpting, on the other hand, or have curls that need some control, use Shu Uemuras Kaze Wave. I wouldnt use regular mousse to air-dry. Either hair type can reach for Aprs Beach Wave and Shine Spray by Oribe. A lot of the beach sprays take the shine out and make hair tangly. This will give you a beachy look, but still keep it shiny while smoothing out your ends, says Colihan.The trick to applying it is to lift the hair up and apply it-not directly on the top.
4. Divide your hair into sections. Do five sections. Two in the front, two behind that, and then one in the back. says Colihan.
5. Start twisting. Try to twist the pieces different waystoward and away from your face, says Colihan. But remembermost importantlytwist the two sections in the front away from your face. Translation: Just keep twisting until dry. You can do this really anywhereI had one hand on the subway pole and twisted the rest of the time en route to my destination.
6. Shake it out. At first the, twisty curls may look a little Goldilocks-esque.Once it is dry, flip your head over, and shake out your hair, says Colihan. Make sure to do it when it is dry, not damp to create a believable natural wave.
The post The Surprising Secret to Perfect Air-Dried Waves appeared first on Vogue.

Taking a top section of hair and separating it from the rest, he create a French twist with the remaining back section of hair, pinning into place with bobby pins. Next, he curled the top section of hair with a 1" barrel iron to create waves. He let the hair cool, and brushed through the waves to loosen them. To finish the look, he pulled the top back, combining it into the French Twist, and pinning to fasten. He sprayed withKrastaseLaque Couture to keep the look lasting all night.

Current Shower Essentials! Now that it's coming nearer and nearer to the colder Winter months, I've decided to slightly change up my shower essentials, or basically what I've been using in the shower on a regular basis.KRASTASE Resistance Bain de Force Reinforcing Shampoo (Level 1-2) (RRP 16.58)I bought this shampoo and conditioner set about 2 years ago and I've repurchased it on 2 or 3 occasions since. I decided to purchase this after 'ombre-ing' my hair. The hairdresser recommended these to help keep my hair in good condition and to provide it with the nourishment that the bleach removed. I was honestly slightly dubious, with the price of them, and that a cheaper drugstore alternative could do just as good. But after a few weeks of using this combination each time I washed my hair, I finally saw what people were talking about!! A combination of regular compliments on my hair, wondering if I had been to the hairdressers, and the difference I saw made me just love this combination! My colour (i.e. the bleach/blonde ends) really looked so vibrant after using this. It looks like it's been freshly coloured- just what you want!I began using this duo each time I showered and then I began using it every other wash. So I would use a regular shampoo and conditioner set (my faves are Aussie's MEGA range or the Miracle Moist range and I also love TREsemm) and then every other time I'd use these from Krastase. My hair still looked as good and it is great condition!KRASTASE Resistance Ciment Anti-Usure Treatment (Level 1-2) (RRP 19.50)This condition is also a great double product. It can be used as your regular shampoo and condition duo (as above) or because of its thick, intense consistency, they also recommend using it as a hair-mask. It's super intense and rich that it doubles up as a great hair-mask. I'd leave this in my hair for a few hours if I could, during a nice pampering evening. Leaving it on overnight also works a treat!The price for both these are quite high, compared to most drugstore shampoos and conditioners, but in my opinion it is really worth it. You can even get away with buying these and perhaps only using once a week and they'll last much longer. You will still see a huge difference. (I wish I had taken some pics of how my hair looked when I had regularly used this duo!) Even with regular use, I found that these both lasted an above-average time length. I only had to repurchase these approx. every 6 months (and longer when I cut down to using these less often). So you do get good value for your money. Another tip I have is to purchase these NOW (i.e. this time of year in your nearest Peter Mark) where they have a gift set made up in a lovely pretty box for the festive season. For approx. 34/36 you get both of these (full size) AND a free 50ml of their Elixir hair oil. Ideal for a gift for a girlfriend or just even for yourself. You get to try these out and get a free hair oil too! Or I often purchase mine fromFeelUniquewhere they regularly do Special Offers or discounts on both of these! So keep an eye on their website! (Did you know they also do FREE DELIVERY?!)Liz Earle Cleanse & Polish Hot Cloth Cleanser (RRP 23.50)I first bought Liz Earle after hearing so many people rave about it, and that's what I'm going to do here! I love this! Simple as!! (I've done a guest-post, detailed review on Anita's Beauty Bloghereso have a look).Quick tip- I first bought a 100ml pumpherefrom LizEarle.ie but since then I always restock when I'm in Boots in Liffey Valley. I think I've told you all this before- the Boots in Liffey Valley is AMAZING! It has so many brands that you can't buy in any other store in Ireland e.g. Liz Earle. It also has other fabulous brands like Sleek Makeup, Nails Inc. Philosophy skincare, Jack Wills, Dr. Jart, Instyler, Ojon, Urban Decay, This Works, Trilogy, Bumble and Bumble, bareMinerals etc. I could go on- I literally spend over an hour in that store!! Also if you're a Student like me- you can get 10% discount on ALL these brands and so much more with your Student Travel Card. You also can earn points on your Advantage Card- which means money back! DOUBLE BONUS!!!!So if you can make a trip to Liffey Vally be sure to check it out when you're there or you can order online at LizEarle.ie. Around Christmas time they also do great offers of mid-sizes so you can try it out for less!Gilette Venus Spa Breeze Razor (RRP 11.99)Pretty standard, a razor that has a lovely scent. I went from using cheaper razors and have now used this for years and I would not go back! It is pretty expensive versus the disposable or cheaper razors, but for me it's worth it. I cannot stand sore, cut, or red under-arms or legs i.e. razor burns from the cheaper ones, and I haven't had that experience with this razor! Winner for me! It's beginning to look a lot like christmas ... Noch 22 Tage bis es wieder so weit ist - das erste Trchen ffnen. Wenn es ein Fest gibt, fr das vermutlich die meisten von uns nie zu alt werden, dann wohl Weihnachten - und zwar so richtig mit allem Drum und Dran: Weihnachtsmarkt, Pltzchen backen und verschlingen, den Baum (oder in unserem Fall eher: den Tannenzweig) schmcken, Weihnachtslieder bis zum Erbrechen hren und singen und natrlich jeden Tag die Trchen vom Adventskalender ffnen. Wir sind sicher nicht die einzigen die das ALLES noch konsequent durchziehen? Wir mchten euch heute ein sehr schnes Exemplarim Rahmen einer gesponserten Kooperation vorstellen, nmlich den Krastase Adventskalender 2015.Optisch entspricht er schon mal zu hundert Prozent unserer Vorstellung - wenn wir selbst einen designen knnten, wrde dieser vermutlich genau so aussehen. Hinter den 24 Trchen verstecken sich Produkte aus verschiedenen Linien von Krastase, von Shampoo ber Splung bishin zu Masken ist alles dabei. Durch die Darstellung der Silhouette hat man schon eine kleine Vorahnung, aber wir verraten euch hier nicht den konkreten Inhalt, das soll natrlich eine berraschung bleiben! Der Kalender ist ziemlich gro und schwer, die enthaltenen Produkte sind ungefhr als grozgige Reisegren einzuschtzen - also man hat einiges davon! Der Kalender kostet 80  und ist in einer limitierten Auflage von 3000 Stck in ausgewhlten Krastase Salons und Douglas Filialen, sowie bei Oliver Schmidt in Dsseldorf erhltlich.Falls er euch gefllt, probiert doch euer Glck; auf der Krastase Facebook Seite gibt es ab heute ein Gewinnspiel, bei dem ihr ihn gewinnen knnt! :)Auch eine Schokoadventskalender darf bei uns jedes Jahr nicht fehlen, das ist irgendwie einfach Kindheitserinnerung pur! Meine (Lenas) Mama schickt mir auerdem seit mittlerweile 4 Jahren jedes Jahr den Adventskalender aus der Dresdner Neustadt zu. Ich freue mich jedes Jahr darber, weil die Zeichnung so liebevoll ist und er an der Wand einfach hbsch aussieht, auch wenn keine Schokolade drin ist ;) Falls ihr noch auf der Suche nach einem etwas anderes Adventskalender seid, knnen wir euch auerdem den 24 Gute Taten Adventskalender sehr ans Herz legen. Der Kaufpreis untersttzt als Spende diverse gemeinntzige Projekte und jeden Tag erfhrt man hinter dem Trchen, um welches Projekt es sich handelt. Fr mehr Infos schaut einfach mal auf der Internetseite vorbei - wir finden die Idee sehr schn! Ein Adventskalender ist auch generell eine tolle Geschenkidee fr alle, die im November oder Anfang Dezember Geburtstag haben, oder fr alle, die in euren Augen "einfach mal so" ein kleines oder greres Dankeschn verdient haben.*Dieser Blogpost wurde von Krastasegesponsert. Vielen Dank dafr! Fr mehr Informationen, klickt einfachhier.

Backstage Beauty: Thakoon Fall 2014 What happens when a Seattle girl leaves the Pacific Northwest for a sojourn in the Big Apple? That was the self-posed question Thakoon Panichgul contemplated before conceiving his Fall 2014 designs. The result? Earthy knits and bold floral prints enhance structured tulip skirts and tailored pants, in keeping with his signature casual-chic style.

Mane maven Odile Gilbert for Krastase Paris complements these creations with Gym Chic hairdos that are simultaneously natural and sleek. Imagine a girl whos just finished working out, Gilbert says. Shes sweating, so her hair is a bit wet in front. Texture-building Krastase Paris Spray A Porter beach spray is first applied to damp locks, which Gilbert then blows dry with a boar bristle paddle brush. Using a healthy amount of Lift Vertige gel and only her fingertips, Gilbert next roughens up the hairline, slicking strands off foreheads for an extreme wet look. Touche Perfection, an innovative on-the-go nourishing treatment for dry ends, lends front pieces additional shine. In the back, tresses have an opposite appearance: fluffy, matte and loose, achieved via multiple applications of Powder Bluff dry shampoo.

Au natural glam is best expressed with healthy, luminous features, so NARS Cosmetics artist Diane Kendal starts by using NARS Skin Luminous Moisture Cream to hydrate and boost brightness. Sheer Glow Foundation and Radiant Creamy Concealer (both ideal for all dermis types) even skin tones, hide dark circles and blur the appearance of fine lines. A few dabs of pearl-hued Copacabana Illuminator are all cheeks need for dewy sheen. I love this light-reflecting liquid because it not only enhances the complexion, but it also creates a shimmering incandescence thats extremely alluring, Kendal raves. Eyes dont need a lot: A thin swipe of creamy, coffee-colored Mambo Eyeliner Pencil contours upper lids, while the Chocolate side of Dolomites Duo Eyeshadow (debuting this fall) is smudged smokily with a contoured brush under lower lash lines.
Manis match eyes in terms of color. Gina Edwards glosses active-length, rounded-square nails with Morgan Taylor Nail Lacquer in Latte Please, a moody mushroom shade. Morgan Taylor debuted last summer, so its a new collection, and we concept original polish pigments each season, informs Edwards. This one was ideal for Thakoon because its fresh, like a Seattle girl would be, yet still boasts a funky, artsy twist.Francesca Moisin

[Photos courtesy of Morgan Taylor Lacquer; NARS; Krastase Paris]

Latest in Beauty BBB Dream Box 2 | Review Okay so this post is slightly delayed because I've only just managed to come home to this, Yodel (yes I'm naming and shaming) managed to mess up my order a couple of weeks ago when I was home for the weekend, meaning by the time it arrived, I had to go back to uni and wait until I was back for Christmas.Anyhow, this is the second box by legendary beauty blogger, Jane Cunningham (Read my review of the last box here), so when it was finally announced to come out at 12pm, I was all set up ready to purchase, I even had a couple of other people ready to too!Unfortunately the website crashed cue lots of frantic refreshing and worrying it had sold out, thankfully after signing the waitlist - I managed to get my hands on, what can only be described, as the best box. EVER.I'm the first to admit now that I think beauty boxes are kind of done now, everyone seems to have gotten on the bandwagon and birchboxes each month just don't seem to be as exciting as they once used to be. However with the Dream box, each product is a treat knowing that its one of Jane's old time classics or a new discovery, and with it packed to the brim with products, its completely worth the 21.95!Here's what was inside this time :-)Krastase Bain Satin 1 Shampoo and ConditionerFirstly a cute little set of travel size Krastase Shampoo and Conditioner, perfect for normal to slightly dry hair.I've never actually used Krastase shampoo and conditioner before, so I was pleasantly surprised with these generous samples.I found they left my hair feeling soft, shiny and well nourished, whilst also leaving it smelling amaaaaazing.You know that hair smell you have when you just leave the salon? That's exactly how your hair smells and feels after using these, would definitely recommend to anyone who needs a little pick me up for their hair.Sleek Pout Polish (in the colour 'The Show')A little pot of lip polish to chuck in your bag when you're on the go, it's perfect if you want to add a subtle hint of colour to your lips whilst also adding a little shine and keeping them well nourished.It also smells absolutely delicious, I think its a vanilla scent, either way it smells great.InvisibobblesI've been sent some Invisibobbles before, and I absolutely love them. These are perfect to use if you want to tie your hair up without damaging your hair, as they simply don't pull or snag your hair. (You then don't get that hair tie headache, ouch)Although they don't have a firm grip as much as I'd like, (I usually tie my hair in a high pony) but they are perfect to tie your hair up whilst you're getting ready or to sleep in, because they leave no kinks in your hair.Every girl needs to have them, they do them in a wide variety of colours - the yellow is alright for blondes, however they offer clear ones which are my favourite.Nude ProGenius Treatment OilI've been wanting to try Nude products for ages, however their hefty price tag has always put me off, so I was glad to see this was in the box.I think people tend to shy away from Facial oils, simply because putting something oily on your skin just seems to be asking for breakouts, however they're actually really good for regenerating the good oil in your skin that it needs, keeping it hydrated and nourished. This sample size is extremely generous too, so I can see myself getting a couple of months out of this!Ardell False EyelashesI love love love false eyelashes and I can't go on a night out without them, they're great at adding a bit more oomph to your eyes, so these are definitely a must have. They're not like the usual ones I would wear for a night out, but they're great for a casual evening as they're a bit more natural looking, whilst also adding volume.Ciat LashlightsNow here is a product I've never thought to try before, this wand of colour is supposed to be added to the tip of your eyelashes to add a pop of colour. At first I wasn't really taken by it when Jane was demonstrating the pink one in her video, however I was pleasantly surprised once I used this. Fortunately, I have green eyes so I think the green colour brings them out a bit more without it being a bit too much, I don't think I would necessarily try them out in any other colour though as I'm not that bold!Burt's Bees Lemon Butter Cuticle Cream and Baume Du Jardinier Gardener's Hand HealerWinter often means that hands and cuticles dry out pretty easily and it's important to keep moisturising your hands as you would do with your face, to stop them drying out. The Burt's Bees cuticle cream has a delicious lemon scent and can be added to your cuticles every day without leaving them feeling greasy. Overnight it intensely moisturisers your cuticles, therefore leaving no flaky dry bits that you tend to pick (which makes it worse, and it's gross - I know, bad habit!). The little tin means it easy for you to keep on you whenever and a little bit goes a long way.I've never heard of the brand Baume du Jardinier, but

Why You Should Always Use a Hair Sunscreen ONOKY  Fabrice LEROUGE/Getty Images
We all love the sun, that much is truebut its detrimental effects on our health and beauty cannot be denied. Makeup? Melted. Skin? Burnt. Hair? Fried. We do everything we can to evade damage, but theres one thing you may be missing in your head-to-toe sun protection routine.
Hair sunscreen by name may sound exclusively like the province of people who find superfluous products to be necessary. It sounds about as necessary as a lash-lengthening base coat under your mascara, which is to say, not necessary at all. And yet! If you value the health of your hairand of course you doprotecting your strands with SPF is an absolute must. Without it, your hair is susceptible to color fade, serious dryness and dehydration, and even premature thinning. And if youre using hot tools to style before or after sun exposure? Forget about it.
All beauty fanatics who once squeezed lemons on their hair to lift the color in the sun know that the heat and brightness from its rays actually bleach hair. Even if you dont apply lemon or, god forbid, Sun-In to accelerate the process, the sun is still inflicting damage. Colored hair, virgin hair, chemically processed hairnobody is safe, which is why a bonafide hair sunscreen is an absolute must.
The good news is that you now have a totally justifiable reason to invest in a new must-have beauty product. You can find a great selection of SPF hair protectants at various prices, from the high-end Krastase Soleil Aqua-Seal to the (slightly) more affordable Aveda Sun Care Protective Hair Veil. You no longer have any excuse for coming home with brittle, sun-scorched hair after a long day at the beach.

Krastase Discipline Collection: shampoo, conditioner, treatment mask 
Krastase launched their Discipline Smoothing In-Salon Treatment as well as their at home Discipline linein August this year. It was designed as a new keratin strengthening treatment to replace/reduce the need for salon chemical straightening and to keep your hair frizz free for longer between blow drying.
The treatment combines Morpho-Keratine and wheat proteins that strengthens the hair fibres from the inside out, and also a moisturising top coat of polymers to keep frizz at bay. The at-home products are supposed to provide the anti-humidity and anti-frizz effects for 72 hours.
I adoreKrastase hair treatments (Nutri-Thermique masque is still my favourite of all time), so I was looking forward to trying out the Discipline Collection on my dry, colour-damaged hair.


Krastase Discipline Fondant Fluidealiste ($48 rrp/250mL) is a lightweight every day conditioning productfor unruly hair, Krastase says that it is bestfor fine, sensitised hair. My hair is probably on the thicker side, so I think I would need something with a bit more horse power to detangle on bad hair days- on good hair days it works fine and generally leaves my hair in quite good condition after drying.

TheKrastase Discipline Maskertine ($60/200mL) is truly gorgeous, as I suspected it would be. It leaves my hair feeling amazingly supple, reduces blow drying time, and imparts a nice sheen to my hair. It is a pleasure to use in the shower- it has an expensive, indulgent fragrance that I always notice with Krastase products, and it detangles like nobodys business (less breakage in shower= win).
There are two shampoo products in the Krastase Discipline collection- the Krastase Discipline Fluidealiste ($48/250mL) and the Krastase Discipline Fluidealiste Sulphate Free ($42/250mL). I was sent the sulphate formulation- which is a shame because my sensitive scalp doesnt do well with them so I wasnt able to give this a good run. From my short experience of 2-3 washes it feels like it washes well without being overly harsh. Smells lovely too.
Prima ballerina Diana Vishneva was chosen as the face of the new collection- she represents beautiful, grace, and discipline.
note: these products were sent by PR for review. See editorial policy in PR tab for more details.

bombshell Hair can be yours with these new super stylers @KerestaseUSA, #Hair It was hair stylist Odile Gilbert who once said to me, backstage at a Carmen Marc Valvo runway show during fashion week, that when a woman is attempting a complicated hair style such as a special updo, she is better off leaving it in the hands of a stylist, and a salon. And that might be correct, but most of the time, with good products, a woman can DIY with great results. Fortunatley,Krastase Paris continues to add cutting add products in their first-ever styling range that the brand launched in 2013.
Recently, Krastaseexpanded the styling products range with some new products in a collection called:Bombshell Luxe, three new products for maximum creativity with long-lasting hold: Baume Double Je, Laque Noire, and V.I.P.Formulated with a new generation of micronized polymers discovered by LOreal Advanced Research, each product help you to transform your hairs texture and shape, but still allow you to move it around, and keep it touch-able (because no one wants to reach out an touch a handful of straw). The products also wont damage the hair fiber.
Here is a rundown on what you can expect from the trio of hair treats that give you bombshell hair (plus one more truly remarkable product to help you make any hair style, better)!





V.I.P. from Krastase (200 ML $37.00, 75 ML $20.00) may be the secret weapon you use constantly when youre attempting holiday hair looks, because this weightless backcomb effect spray gives hair texture, volume, and long-lasting hold. If you are doing an updo or anything more complicated than a few curls, you need volume and control, something for pins to grip as well. This product will give you a high level of texture plus long lasting hold and a  Backcomb Effect without the damage. If you want big hair this is a way to get it, thanks to what Kerestase calls their Patented Horizontal Diffusion. You just need to know how to use it: shake well and apply to dry or pre-dried hair. Re-work the hair with fingers to instantly add volume and style. It actually smells very light and pleasant, too.


Baume Double Je from Krastase ($37.00 2.5 fl. oz.) isanextra workable defining balm, used for both construction and finish, is a half paste/half cream formula that offers medium hold and adjustable resistance. This hybrid balm structures and texturizes the hair for long-lasting hold thanks to its endlessly re-sculptable formula. It will help you shape and re-shape hairstyles but it isnt stiff.
Benefits:
Long-lasting Medium Hold
Ultra Workable
Adjustable Radiance
Grants Texture
Great for Bobs/Pixies

To Use: on dry or damp hair, rub a small amount (about the size of a quarter) of balm between the hands and then apply it either section by section or throughout the hair.

Once you have a style you like, youve got to hold it...and the newLaque Noire from Krastase(75 ML $20.00; 300 ML $37.00) is the highest-hold hairspray in Krastases portfolio. It is a micro-diffusion spray with a water-free formula that gives extra-strong hold and acts as an anti-humidity shield. It instantly and intensely sets the style for either controlled volume or extreme structuring. Unlike a lot of other hairsprays, this one not only doesnt dull shine, it adds it, while keep hair soft to the touch. It dries quickly without too much odor, and it lasts (Kerestase says up to 48 hours but I didnt test it that long). With the holidays fast approaching, is is a little splurge that you might find is a priceless investment.

styling products that cost less than a big latte? yes please! @SuaveBeauty,#StyleItYourself ,  #Hair 
Styling products help make your style work better and last longer, but youve got to know what is going to work for you. You can pay a lot of money for fancy styling products, but frankly, there are plenty of budget-minded stylers that are really very good. For example, Suave Professionals encourages you to do your own hair (and pocket the savings for something sensational for Spring and Summer instead) with a niftycollection of seven sensational Suave ProfesionalsLuxe Style Infusion products. These are inexpensive, just $4.99. These days you cant get a large fancy latte for thatand yet these Suave Professionals Luxe Style Infusion products are pleasant to use and high performance, too. Theyre a beauty find.

Get advice and tips for free: If you want to SIY (style it at home) you can also get some free help from the pros,as there are inspirational photos, and alsovideo tutorials on theSuave Web site.But there are DIY *or SIY if you will information with diagrams on every products. How cool is that?!
I dont think that Suave really has to compare itself to other brands (in this case, Krastase products) because I feel that Suaves products can stand on their own, without having to make a comparison to a particular brand. If you believe in your products, why not just say ours do a great job and leave it at that?! But I do understand that the company is trying to make the point that you dont have to spend a lot of money (at least not all the time) for styling products that you might just use now and then. Using inexpensive styling products let you try new hair styles that require volume, or hold, and if you dont really like the look you havent invested a pot of money in a product you wont use again.
Part of what I dont like about some styling products (and I know readers complain about this as well) is that they smell like chemicals. These Suave products actually have light, floral scents that wont overpower your perfumes, or make your hair smell like it might go up in flames if someone lights a match nearby. The packaging is simple, but nice, as well.

3 Hair Styles You Just Have to Try! Bring salon style home with the brand new Suave Luxe line at Target!
We all LOVE the way our hair looks right after a date with your hairdresser, but since I cant pop into my favorite salon every single morning, I love finding products that I can have at home thatll help me to recreate those looks with ease. With the brand new Suave Professionals Luxe Style Infusion products, now available at Target, you can get salon style right at home. Whether you want curls, volume, or a simple smooth look, theres a Luxe product that will work for you. Whats more, the entire line is proven to work as well as the expensive Krastase that salons use.

Head to Target to find your Luxe Style Infusion products from now until February 7th, 2015 and get a free $5 gift card when you buy four participating Sea Mineral Infusion or Luxe Styling Infusion products.
Try the VOLUME line for hair that feels touchable and is full of body and bounce. Go with frizz-resistant SMOOTH for sleek and shiny hair. Or create defined, weightless and luscious curls with the CURLS line.

Here are a few ideas on how you can use you new Suave Professionals Luxe Style Infusion products!
VOLUME Style Inspiration: Ultimate Body and Bounce
1. Start with Luxe Style Infusion Weightless Blow Dry Spray on damp hair, from roots to ends.
2. Using a round brush blow dry up and away from face.
SECRET TIP: Roll 4-5 large sections of hair down onto scalp and secure with clips.
3. Complete the look with Luxe Style Infusion Plump Hold Hairspray for extra hold. Lightly brush through for a natural look.
SMOOTH Style Inspiration: Sleek Pony
1. Apply Luxe Style Infusion Weather Proof Cream to damp hair for a smooth finish. Using a flat brush, blow dry.
STYLIST TIP: Blow dry in the direction of where the ponytail will set.
2. Spray Luxe Style Infusion Anti-Humidity Hairspray for hold. Brush into ponytail, securing elastic.
3. Take a small pinch of hair from ponytail and wrap around the elastic. Spray more for extra hold.
CURLS Style Inspiration: Braided Top Bun
1. Apply Luxe Style Infusion Soft Touch Curl Mousse on damp hair, then air dry. Make a high ponytail.
2. Braid the ponytail. Wrap it around the elastic while securing with bobby pins.
3.Pull out baby hairs for an easy breezy look.
Treat your hair to salon style at home! Check out the new Suave Professionals Luxe Style Infusion products at Target! Wed love to hear about which products youd like to try most! Join the conversation and tweet us your answer using #NewLuxeStyle.

☆オーラボタニカ☆ 
愛用中のケラスターゼ(KÉRASTASE)から、自然派女性が待ち望んでいたオーガニック ケアシリーズ「オーラボタニカ(Aura Botanica)」が3月24日に新発売されたの(-^□^-)“ラグジュアリー”と“パフォーマンス”を兼ね備えた新時代の本物のオーガニックのあり方を提案全製品96%以上が自然由来成分で、ノンシリコーン、ノンパラベン、ノンサルフェート処方なのも嬉しい私も、早速使ってます左から、ソワン オーラボタニカ(デイリーヘアトリートメント)、バン オーラボタニカ(シャンプー)、オーラボタニカ エッセンシャル(ヘア・ボディ用オイル)、ユイル オーラボタニカ(洗い流さないトリートメント)高級感あるパッケージ中でも、オーラボタニカ エッセンシャルがお気に入りこれ一本で、ヘア・スカルプ・ボディに使える優れものなんですべたつかず肌に素早く浸透してくれて、香りも心地よい香りで好きオーラボタニカを使っているせいか、髪にツヤがでて、ダメージも改善されました今後も使い続けたいと思いますオーラボタニカ 特集ページはこちらフォローお願いします♡■Instagram■Twitter

케라스타즈 자연주의 라인 런칭 : 아우라 보타니카 2주 체험 후기 케라스타즈 서포터즈인 케라스타지엥이 되고 나서 케라스타즈 제품만 사용하고 있는 요즘. 덕분에 긴 머리이지만 머릿결이 늘 좋은 상태예요. 크크 물론 좋은 머릿결을 위해 염색도 안하고 있고, 펌은 1년만에 올 2-3월즈음 했었는데요. 그동안 관리해서인지 머릿결이 상하지 않았더라고요. 요즘도 매일매일 케라스타즈 샴푸와 컨디셔너, 마스크팩과 오일, 헤어미스트 등을 사용해가며 머릿결을 관리중인데 관리해주면 확실히 머릿결이나 빛깔, 컬 등이 달라서 늘 신경쓰고 있어요. 피부결 만큼이나 중요한게 머릿결이 아닐까 하는 생각 :D 오늘 소개해드릴 제품은 케라스타즈에서 새롭게 출시하는 자연주의 라인이에요. KERASTASE Aura Botanica.......
